Reviews.Title: “Not great....”
Reviews.Author: TLH-82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. I was in the basement and right next to the breakfast room, this was not great as I was woken up by shouting and banging from the staff preparing to open at 7am. The room was small and dingy and didn't feel very clean. A number of the lights didn't work either. There was no information in the room about places to eat etc locally. After exploring myself there were some great pubs and places to eat. Far better places to stay, they need to up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out after 15 minutes”
Reviews.Author: OyVeySydney
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel specifically because I adore London townhouses, it was close to everything and easy access to the train as I was only staying two nights. When I arrived, the manager watch me struggle up the stairs with my luggage and didn't move an inch. I caught him looking at me and he still didn't offer to help. He told me my room was on the first floor and directed me to the lift, however it turned out my room was on the lower ground floor, through a heavy wooden door. I put my bags down, and after a 30 hour flight from Australia, I was looking forward to some quiet, a hot shower and a long sleep. I walked into the bathroom to find it had someone else's POO in there. I called the manager and he promptly found me another room. However, this room was right below reception, with its wooden floor. For a few seconds I thought we were having a storm. Then I realised it was from the people walking above me. All I could hear was the thumping of running children and the thunder of wheeled suitcases being dragged and thumped across the floor. There was no way anyone would be able to sleep with the constant noise. I promptly picked up my bags, and for the first time ever, I walked out. When I got to reception, I told the manager that I couldn't stay in the hotel with rooms like that and could he please call me a taxi. He shrugged, not even bothering to ask me if he could do anything about it, and walked outside, pushing past me as I was again struggling to get my bags out of the door. Thankfully he flagged down a cab, but walked off without even a sorry or a goodbye. After this experience and my previous one last year at the Holiday Inn Wandsworth, I wont ever stay at a Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Fire alarm was going off in my bedroom the entire night, staff was rude and dismissive about the issue. Barely slept. Since I was awake I decided to get some work done...then the internet goes out. Other than not being able to sleep, work or work out, it was your typical budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a family break”
Reviews.Author: JDsale
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night, chose the hotel as I had stayed in the area when in London on business, but most importantly it was within an easy walk of the theatre in Victoria where Wicked was playing and my wife and daughter were going there. We had room 116 which was a family room, quite spacious and very clean. Check-in and out were very quick and efficient, the complimentary breakfast was plentiful, buffet style with sausage, scrambled eggs and beans among the warm offerings, I imagine it can get very busy so best go early! Ideal base to explore, the 24 bus stop is just a hundred yards away and this bus runs all the way up to near Euston, passing Westminster, Trafalgar Square and Leicester Square on the way. Good budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Clare T
Reviews.Content: I used the holiday inn express for an overnight stay in Feb 2012 the reception area was very clean and tidy and the staff were welcoming. The bar is a tiny part of the reception area and does not seat many people. My room was on the third floor and was very noisy I did not get much sleep you can hear the water running down the pipes whenever someone else flushes their toilet or uses the shower etc. The fuse kept going in the room so the TV and hairdryer did not work. Breakfast was served from 7.30 - 10.30am so we went down at 9.30am the breakfast room is a tiny room that does not hold many people this was filled so we had to wait and then clear a table ourselves in order to sit down! then we found out that they was not hot breakfast left neither were there any dishes left to use! we ended up eating somewhere else. Most of the cleaners were on their mobile phones whenever your saw them they did quickly try to put them away so we would not notice!! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and most definitely would not stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday Inn Express I've stayed in - Priority Points Gold member”
Reviews.Author: MrTall_99
Reviews.Content: Its 02.19 in the morning and I'm unable to sleep as my room (205) is like a sauna. There is no thermostat. The radiator is switched off, and I can only open the window on to the main street a certain amount so there is no difference to temperature but I get all the street noise. I've called down to reception to explain but their response was to turn off the heating. The heating is not switched on!!! I explained this a couple of times and have explained that I won't be staying tomorrow night. This is one of those old townhouses that has somehow managed to get itself under the holiday inn express franchise. Im a big fan of Holiday Inn, but this woeful experience reflects very poorly on Holiday Inn Express brand I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Agammemnon
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip, and I tend to stay in Holiday Inn and associated brands becuase of the priority club scheme. First impressions are that it is not you usual 'stand alone' HIX, as it is one of the converted town houses on Belgrave Road. Reception was a bit cramped, but stafg were very helpful. The room itself is standard HIX decor, but unusually, there was no aircon. This could well be a problem in humid summer months, but wasn't really an issue in January, other than my bathroom mirror remained steamed up longer than I would have liked! The room itself (308) had a strange odor coming from the bathroom - almost like a cross btween cats wee and domestos. I checked my colleagues room (305) and it wasn't in there, so just me. Pillows were a bit on the thin side, as were the towels. Also a strange smell coming from the sink, a common problem in HIX hotels as they do not seem to clean the bit of the plug that goes down the sink, which you have to invariably pull out as they never seem to work correctly. Breakfast was the usual stuff, although the room was a bit cramped. The bar at night time is tiny with only ine draft lager, and there is no food available so you have to dine out. As usual, I wore my ear plugs at night, but there did seem to be a fair bit of traffic noise. All in all, not my best experience of a HIX.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely for a weekend stay very close to main attractions and victoria station/pimlico”
Reviews.Author: LottieP23
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here 21 - 22 of January for our anniversary! It was cheaper to come to London for a weekend than stay locally!! We were out all day Saturday sight-seeing and came back to the hotel to check in at around half 5..the staff were really helpful and polite and checked us in quickly giving us information about breakfast and taxi's. The room was on the 2nd floor and was immaculate, we had a kettle, cups and teabags etc and the local newspaper! There was glasses, face wipes, towels and soap for washing provided. The bar is small but it was handy for a pre-drink before dinner and I believe was open until 1am. There are a lot of bars, restuaraunts and pubs nearby if you wanted to stay local and westminster is only a 20 minute walk away. Pimlico station/tube is close by on belgrave road and victoria station is about 10 minutes walk at the other end. It was a tad too stuffy on the heating side but windows do open and there was an electric office fan provided. Breakfast in the morning was very basic - Scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, croissants, yoghurt and juices but no bacon :( on the whole a good service!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but fine for an overnight or short stay”
Reviews.Author: TheoJones
Reviews.Content: I travelled to London Gatwick, and caught the Gatwick Express to Victoria station - this hotel was a short, pleasant walk from the station: very convenient. Reception was polite and reasonably friendly, got my room sorted without hassle, and off to the room. Wow. I know space is at a premium in the heart of London, but this room was one of the smallest I think I have ever been in. Frankly, I had more space in the cabin of the cruise ship we were on in November. Got a decent night's sleep, but thanks to Ear Plugs - the area is very loud at night, and the windows don't block the noise. Bed was comfy though. In the morning, I had breakfast - it was functional and tasty enough, but pretty lack lustre in the presentation and service. I don't think the staff member noticed me until I got up to leave. I probably would stay there again, but only for a single night - and might spring for a double room just for the extra space. I certainly would not stay here if I was spending more than a single night in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre and complacent, but reasonable advance booking price”
Reviews.Author: sendaiben
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms here to go and see Billy Elliott (the Victoria Palace Theatre is nearby). The receptionist was very standoffish, no greeting, no offer to help with bags, very minimal answer to questions. He did answer all our questions, but did not set a very good tone for the stay. The good: -location is pretty convenient, near Victoria Station -it was reasonable for a hotel in London (advanced rate through hotel website) The bad: -some of the staff are standoffish (although the experience at checkout was the complete opposite -very professional and friendly) -the property is a bit worn: one of the rooms had a broken window that wouldn't close properly (big draft) and the shower curtain in the other room was stained -very noisy: traffic noise from the road and footsteps/creaks from the room above -bed too soft -no recognition of Priority Club status or benefits Overall, I wouldn't recommend the hotel. It wasn't terrible, and I would stay there again if I had to, but probably wouldn't choose the property.

Reviews.Title: “one night only for the theatre”
Reviews.Author: liz c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a large but quiet street which is full of hotels. Its a nice quiet area with a few local pubs and restaurants nearby and i lived in this area as a child so nice to be back. Its near the station and the river and the tube so very central to all of london. I stayed at the hotel with priority points but would not pay hard cash to stay here. The price on display by reception was Â£229+vat!!!!!! a ridiculous amount for this sort of hotel. Reception was friendly and we were told the room was quite large. We were put in a twin room in the basement, i felt like one of the servants in victorian times and it was like sharing a room in a work place,but as it was for one night only i accepted this. The window had large security bars on it which was a bit scary in case of fire but it did open to let in fresh air as the corridor and room smelt a bit musty and damp. It had tea and coffee but a dodgy kettle which only stayed boiling with the help of leaning on a tea spoon, very health and safety. We did mention this on leaving the next morning, still we could have a brew. My bed was sort of clean but still felt like it had not been change recently or the sheets were not fully washed and starched, i did have a good look in and around it for cleanliness before i slept in it but the bed was comfortable. The room was clean but a bit grubby, it felt like it was possible a staff bedroom in use for customers in busy times. Though i was told this was not the case next morning. In the morning i was woken by the smell of cigarette smoke and had to shut the window due to the staff smoking outside in some sort of basement storage cellar so we could not open the curtains or window the next morning before leaving. The shower was very good but there was some sort of odd wiring visible below the sink which i was told was earth wire which i thought should have been boxed in and not visible. Breakfast was complimentary which was a good thing and was fairly nice though a bit of a free for all as the room was small, the customers many and you had to help yourself buffet style in a small kitchen area and get milk out of a fridge and plates out of a cupboard, the hot sausages and scrambled eggs were a bit dangerous and i had to ask for help as im small and could not reach and it was very hot with no cloth to hold the pans, still all in all breakfast was fresh and nice. As there are so many hotels in this street to choose from, i think i will go elsewhere if i have to pay cash.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey place but OK”
Reviews.Author: nandover
Reviews.Content: Like others have said this is a very noisy location. Stayed here on 9/26-27/11 and found the hotel to be located in a convenient place, but the outside noise from the street makes it very difficult either to get to sleep or stay asleep. Woke up one night to a fight on the street. Other reviews have indicated that the hotel is noisy, so beware. Lastly, breakfast is served in a room below street level with no windows. It is a buffet style and the food is cooked elsewhere and brought in. They do an OK job but it is probably better to go elsewhere. Hotel seemed clean. It is functional, but if that is the best you can say about a hotel, I will try to look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for people on the go!”
Reviews.Author: annolope
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in mid October. Great place to hang your hat while to see London. Literally a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station and many other popular sites. London is a very safe city, but walking back and forth to the hotel was particularly pleasant, at no time did we feel like we were in a major city. This hotel has no special amenities and is nothing fancy, but it has everything that the tourist on the go would need and the staff are very helpful. The room was clean and comfy. A cont. breakfast is served daily, it includes some hot idems and is plentiful, but does not provide a lot of variety. Internet is not free anywhere in the UK, we had a 30 minute voucher per day that was at no cost or you could pay 10 pounds for 24 hour service. Be aware that this service is only for one device, so be sure the device you log in with is the device you are going to be using. You must pay for each device if you use internet for more than one. We had brought outlet converters with us for the trip, but found that we did not have a 3 pronge converter and upon asking at the desk we were given one to use for our stay. Be aware that the Black cab from Heathrow is going to cost you 65 pounds to get to this hotel. The hotel uses a service that is much better priced, call and ask them to help you with transfer. We did not have the issue with noise that others seemed to have, but I guess that can vary depending on the location of your room. All and all this was a great experience, would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An expensive hotel on a noisy street”
Reviews.Author: Traveller007Finland
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in this property. My room window was to the street and the noise was terrible. When understanding this at the time when goign into bed, I went down to the lobby and asked for earplugs. The "Manager in Duty" said that this "We do not have tehm. This is not a 4-star, neither 5-star property." Great! Normally most of hotels have earplugs - they are not expensive and especially when the hotel is located on such a busy and nosiy location, one could think that the property management woudl understand this. In this hotel they do not. Well. I suffered the noise for onw night and purchased a pair of ear plugs from a chemist. Therefore: I you plan to stay in this hotel, invest into earplugs, the hotel have not done it. Although the room rate makes you think that there should be a lot of amenities, but there is not.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey for 1 night, but I suppose that's London for you!”
Reviews.Author: MT&FT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night after a friends wedding. The room was clean, spacious and quiet. The hotel itself is within walking distance of Victoria and Westminster. The only negative was the buffet breakfast which was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location good value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: SidPCuracao
Reviews.Content: After searching for a long time for a mid budget hotel close to London's Victoria station we settled on the Holiday Express. We've stayed in some unknown supposed 4 star places before and been seriously disappointed so wanted to have an idea of what we were getting with a well know chain. We flew into London from the Caribbean and were flying out 2 days later to Thailand so wanted somewhere central to meet friends and shop with easy access to Gatwick and Heathrow Airports. After reading some of the less favorable reviews we didn't have high expectations but as it was somewhere simply to sleep we thought the cost fair for a central London hotel. On arrival at 10am we were told that the room we had booked (inadvertantly the family room) wasn't ready but we could have a double straight away. As we had been travelling for 10 hours and had a meeting at 2pm in the city we opted to take the double for a quick shower and power nap. The room was tiny and we would have no doubt had a bigger room if we'd stuck with our original booking, but we're used to living in a small cabin on a yacht so that didn't bother us. There was no A/C in the room and it was surprisingly hot in London, but with the window open and the fan supplied on it was fine. The room was spotlessly clean and modern and the bed small but comfortable. The internet was expensive and as we'd read about it's lack of speed we didn't bother. The breakfast in the morning was self service but with a good selection of hot and cold options as well as fresh fruit which we were more than happy with. Overall this hotel was as you'd expect a hotel chain to be, clean, modern and convenient, but it was the staff that made it a great stay for us. They couldn't have been more friendly or helpful, from the early check in and late checkout, supplying us with ironing board and iron on request and letting us leave luggage for free until we were ready to get our next flight. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but pricey very good location”
Reviews.Author: glenburn1
Reviews.Content: meal deal at Â£22good value but have to take evening meal then breakfast next morning did not suit as we where leaving early next morning room good size but bathroom small no towel rail staff left towels on bed on open plan wardrobe sort it out early morning did not happen as we were leaving staff member mentioned it a bit to late very close to bus station about 150 meters also short walk to buckingham palace

Reviews.Title: “If you know what to expect, you will be ok here”
Reviews.Author: TomMiddletown_DE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here pre-cruise for one night. If you are familiar with small London hotels, you will know that your room will be tiny, just enough room for 2 people, should be clean and tidy. This property feel squarely in the above model. We stayed here using frequent customer points. I would not pay the posted tariff for this location. A bit of a walk to Victoria Station / Coach station. I would not do it with luggage. We did and I would not recommend it. The area is full of small tourist hotels, and pricey restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Get a hotel somewhere else if you are a couple.”
Reviews.Author: miller2450
Reviews.Content: This was not at all what we expected, what a shock when we saw the size of the room. I asked if he had anything else and he tole me they were all the same except there was one down the hall which was about 2 feet wider used for a crib so we moved there. We had just come back from a cruise and wanted to spend 4 days in London before flying back to Florida. Our standard room on the cruise ship was larger than the room at the hotel and more closet space. We had to sleep with the window open with all the noise from the traffic on busy Belgrave Rd bvecauuse there was not air conditioning, i would not want to be there in the summer. It was not at all what it appeared from the pictures when i booked it on the internet and they charge was $235. a night however i belong to a travel club and got it for $185. but still not worth the price. I can say trhat the cont breakfast was ok and the staff was helpful and friendly except one. but with only a double bed this room is not for couples

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: redhead49
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night. My room was OK but pretty small and the toilet was behind the bathroom door. There was heating but no air conditioning and it as its on a busy road, it was too noisy to open the window. Breakfast was strange - you have to go down to the basement and do EVERYTHING yourself. You even have to go and find your own cutlery!. OK for a single night but I wouldn't have liked to stay here any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: musicmakerHighland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel as a whole was acceptable but the breakfast room was cramped and the choice of food for breakfast was nothing short of abismal! the hot/warm food on offer was scrambled egg & sausages, often ran out of egg! also ran out of; butter / knives & spoons the milk was off one morning all in all a bad breakfast experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MarkusSOulu
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent hotel and there seem to be good deals available occasionally (got it for Â£100/night). However, as I can't cope without a good internet connection, I would never stay in HI Express London-Victoria again because their wifi/ISP sucks big time: - When surfing, 70% of the web page loads completely fail to connection timeouts or DNS lookup failures. Of the rest 30% maybe 5% loads perfectly (although painfully slow... I'm talking about minutes, not seconds) and 25% loads partially (the slowness applies here as well). So it was _really_ unreliable. - Additionally, I had to spend one whole evening troubleshooting the internet connectivity issues with the hotels ISP (isrighthere.com) as the ISP was having even more serious issues than normally and apparently none of the visitors in the hotel were able to even login to the network. I'd have preferred the hotel employees to take care of this instead of me having to talk to various tech reps at the ISP. For Â£9.95 per 24 hours this was unbearable (they did refund one voucher me after complaining but still, for such a steep price, you'd expect to get MUCH better service). I understand that the network issues are mostly the problem of the ISP but, it didn't seem like I was the first (or the last) one having the problems so I would think any above-utterly-crappy hotel would simply switch their provider. Generally, the hotel was better than some of the worst I've seen in London but as quite many have already said, you can find much better in the same price range (just continue searching on tripadvisor).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: goalie2007
Reviews.Content: For the price 110 GBP, in London, it was a terrific deal. The room was nice and clean, everything worked fine, the bed was clean and comfortable, the staff was helpful and friendly. We even had a magnificent view of Big Ben and the London eye. We elected to sleep in rather than go to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Holiday inn express ever used, no service no attempt at basic health and safety!”
Reviews.Author: diverse7
Reviews.Content: No breakfast available at 9am, fire doors propped open with towels, rubbish bags everywhere, worst HIE ever

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a nite in oct 2010. the rooms are small but clean. very basic. unfortunately also the price was expensive at 200 pounds a nite. next day went to crowne plaza st james at a 110 pounds very much nicer and grand. the hotel is situted within 5 mintues walk to the Pilmico tube station within the city centre. very limited shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic!!”
Reviews.Author: Gymball
Reviews.Content: This is a very basic no frills hotel. Bedroom small with poor lighting. Pillows very soft and towels well washed and thin. Breakfast simple affair and all do it yourself. Without a doubt there are nicer better value places to stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and very cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: FavaBean45
Reviews.Content: A cheap B&B near Victoria station, on a quiet road, this hotel has no frills and a basic breakfast. Its only a 15 minute walk to the station, not far from Buckinham Palace and all the other major tourist sites. Some very nice pubs along the way too. Its perfect for a place to crash out after spending the day out enjoying London. My only gripe was our room was very warm in the evening, but there was a fan to take the edge off the heat. I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not for relaxation -below average”
Reviews.Author: Bright0nian
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for theatre/shopping break. The hotel is not worthy of the title 'no frills'. The one lift which could comfortably carry only 2 people with their luggage takes an age to travel up and down the 5 floors meaning the stairs is the only option most of the time. Room was clean but basic but no air conditioning which makes it intolerable in the hot/humid weather. The only option is to open the window which means directly onto a noisy street if you are at the front of the hotel. Beds are soft and springy - great if you like and vice versa. One of the reasons for booking was the inclusive breakfast in the price. This turned out to be served in a basement airless room. The serving area is no more than a large kitchen. An A/C unit was attached to the ceiling but was not turned on. Breakfast was basic - Sausages and scrambled egg are the only hot options. You would definitely not be hanging around this dungeon type atmosphere long. I wont be back - there are many other better options around the area.

Reviews.Title: “over priced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: michleec
Reviews.Content: just returned from London and stayed here two nights--the bill was $640! For that we got a small stuffy room with no air conditioner (and London was hot), a breakfast that consisted of cereal and toast/pastries, a small elevator, laundry bags strewn throughout the corridors. Place is completely self service. The staff was adequate--not super helpful but polite. The only plus was the location. for what you get at this hotel you should not pay more than $150 a night. We know London is expensive but this place is a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the "Holiday Inn Express" name”
Reviews.Author: TravelPr011
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on our previous(excellent) experiences with Holiday Inn express hotels in the US. The hotel is about a 6 minute walk from Victoria station, about 3 minutes from Pimlico station. On arrival the desk manager was very helpful and friendly. For the most part, the front desk staff was helpful and polite.The room for double occupancy was tiny and crammed. The room faced the main street and was very noisy, especially in the morning and late at night. The bed was reasonably comfortable.There was no real place to put your luggage. A luggage rack was present but if used, it would block half of the clothes shelving. The second suitcase had no space at all, so we ended up placing it on top of the bookshelf. The bathroom had no cups or glasses, nor did it have a shower/tub mat. There was a piece of chewing gum stuck to the floor.The bed had stained sheets and the plastic lined mattress pad had blood stains and yellow stains on it. Upon requesting new sheets for the bed, I was handed a bottom sheet, without a word of regret or acknowledgment of the problem. Housekeeping was very sketchy at best. One day we would get new coffee packets and creamer, the next day we would not. Breakfast was the same thing every morning, no variety at all, but acceptable and fresh. The wireless Internet in the room was very expensive, took a long time to connect and was very slow. We ended up getting "stuck" due to the volcanic ash cloud and thought it very odd, that the additional night we had to add to our stay climbed up in price by quite a bit of money. We felt, that this hotel did not deserve to claim association with the "Holiday Inn Express" name.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate prices, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlgreene
Reviews.Content: As this was a moderate, budget hotel, I was very pleased with its cleanliness and size. We had a 2nd floor room overlooking the streets, and I thought the size was small but adequate for my husband and me. The front desk staff was friendly but there was only ever one person there at a time. It was within walking distance of both Pimlico and Victoria Station, and also close enough to walk elsewhere. I also felt like it was a safe neighborhood. The one thing we found was that the heat was high in the building (you couldn't control it in your unit). We opened our window every night and had a fan running, which helped to moderate the temperature. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but forget breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: loftylad
Reviews.Content: location of this hotel is great, especially for a theatre break. However, the breakfast room sits about 30 people at a push. The hygiene in the breakfast room is totally unacceptable. The chilled items for your breakfast are not chilled, the washing up area is in a small room within the breakfast room, the member of staff doing washing up then handles your open food items with the same washing up gloves on. The duty manager appears to be totally uninterested in any comment you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, neat, adequate, but small room”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoRoy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is neat, well kept, very professional atmosphere, staff were excellent and helpful, comes with a continental breakfast which was good. No regular restaurant on premise. I did find problems with the room being so small though. By the time you get your luggage in there, you are out of room to walk around. For sure no moe than 2 people in that room. The bed was confortable. No airconditioning, just fan. They advertise a room with a sofa, which is suppose to be larger, but you have to reserve that ahead of time. Except for the small room, it is fine.

Reviews.Title: “There are too many better choices in the area - Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: TheCriticalTraveler
Reviews.Content: On the same street there are several other well know USA hotels to chose from as well as samller local hotels that will give you more for your money. This hotel needs retraining in customer service and how to advise guests who are traveling in a foreign country and would rely on thier advise and information. I can't say it more clearly, Look Elsewhere-the choices are plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but dribbling shower”
Reviews.Author: justmusic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very convenient - 2 mins from Pimlico Tube and less than 10 mins walk from Victoria mainline. No. 24 bus also goes past which goes on to Trafalgar Square and beyond. The road is reasonably quiet - the whole road is hotels and residential so no nightclubs to keep you awake. Room was very clean and neatly finished. Any smaller and it would have been cramped, but these sort of hotels are for sleeping in, not lounging about in all day. Bed comfortable: choice of hard or soft pillows which I've not seen elsewhere. Good picture on flatscreen LCD TV (not always the case) with the full range of Freeview channels. Shower very disappointing though. Hardly any pressure/flow - similar to a low powered electric one. If I'd been there a few days I would have mentioned it to the front desk. Breakfast OK - standard range of Kelloggs cereals, choice of breads and preserves, tea, coffee, juices. Exactly as expected and something of the "USP" for HI Express over Travelodge and other 'room only' offerings. As a London bed for the night, this is perfectly adequate. It's convenient (for transport and, as it happens, my London office), clean and quiet. Price was OK as well - I paid Â£117 for a fully flexible rate on the Government price, which I qualify for. Even cheaper rates were available on non-flexible advance purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than small”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoEmmy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here sightseeing in London. The room though clean was so small that we had to store the suitcases in the bathroom and transfer them back into the room while showering. The location was good though much closer to Pimlico tube station than Victoria. Unfortunately, the lobby and bar were under renovations while we were there. The breakfast was adequate , again nothing special. I think this hotel would be fine for 1 or 2 nights but too small for anything longer. Next visit to London, I'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel smelt like a homeless hostel.”
Reviews.Author: sebzmoll
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel direct by telephone on Friday 30th Oct 09, check in 1st Nov a double room for 1 night, and spoke with a member of staff who informed me the room was Â£89 including... Comp Breakfast and Internet access which for me was a steal, a little bit out of my chosen area but we had a car so it didn't matter. the internet was by far more important than locstion. When we arrived we were greeted at reception which I can only say was.......well a 0 star welcome. I handed over my card and was told what I had for my Â£89 and strangely enough internet not included. I asked for the manager who was pretending not to be the manager......... very funny, and neither the male receptionist nor the.... I'm not the manager would believe I had been informed the internet was included. I was told rather rudely if I was not happy there was a hotel down the road with free internet access in a shared room with other travellers for Â£40. I tried my best to explain to the 2 guys if you check the booking you will know exactly who had given me the original FALSE information (Strangely Mr I'm not the manager looked rather embarrassed in front of his colleauge who by the look on his face was feeling slighly uncomfortable.... his accent started to ring a bell with me!!! I was offered a cancellation but was so tired I decided to just go up to the room and put it down to a one off bad experience, as I have stayed in Holiday inns several times previous ...Not an express though. We went in the lift to the third floor and as the door opened the stench of an old un-washed vagrant waved over us!!!!!! needless to say we got out of there ASAP If you fancy staying in an expensive smelly hostel I would reccommend The Holiday Inn London Victoria......Congratulations Guys Jurys Inn was great and only Â£10 extra with the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced budget hotel that doesn't deliver.”
Reviews.Author: merchy20
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good as it is not far from Pimlico tube station and a short walk to the Thames. However there are lots of hotels on Belgrave Road and despite it being a budget hotel, this was an uncomfortable and overpriced hotel to stay in. Some of the staff were perfectly friendly and willing to help but I felt others had inadequate customer service training. For example, we were offered free drinks as we checked in early but had to ask 4 times before it arrived. The hotel itself wasnâ€™t great. The reception bins were overflowing, the lifts were painfully slow (disabled travellers beware) and the corridors and stairwells were stifling. We were provided with a fan that didnâ€™t work followed by a very dusty fan to cool ourselves. I resorted to leaving the window open. The layout of the room meant the space between the large desk at the window and the bed was minimal, making the desk pointless to sit and write on or use a laptop. The bathroom was clean and the shower was fine. There was quite a bit of dust on the cabinets and other wooden items in the room, but on the whole, the room was relatively clean. The beds in our small third floor room would have been comfortable, but getting sleep in this hot room was not easy. When we checked out, the luggage storage in reception was a few shelves in the corner behind the reception area. You could walk in off the street, pick a bag and walk off, no questions asked. I decided against using this facility. Breakfast is included in the price of the room and there was a choice of cereals, fruit and toast. Coffee and juice machines were available for drinks. Iâ€™ve stayed in budget hotels across England and they have been good experiences, but this certainly wasnâ€™t one of them. Iâ€™ll opt for the Best Western across the street next time Iâ€™m in London.

Reviews.Title: “Room 208 is a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: EamonK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and for its central location. The reception and bar are currently being renovated so the reception is, understandably, not quite as smart as you would normally expect. The rooms are small but pretty much what you would expect for the location. They are clean and of a good standard. However, room 208 seemed to have absolutely no sound proofing at all. The traffic on Belgrave Road started at about 5am and was extremely loud. I'm not a light sleeper but found it very difficult to get back to sleep due to the volume of the external noise. I'd booked this stay so that I would be fresh for a business meeting in the vicinity first thing in the morning but that certainly backfired! I'll be looking for alternative hotels for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & central, but needs a refresh.”
Reviews.Author: 2007jojo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Victoria Express for 3 nights of a 7 night trip to London. I paid via a business travel agent and paid Â£150 per night. My flight landed very early & I was lucky to find there was a room ready (apparently rare) & the check in process was swift and as friendly as can be expected at that time of the morning! I had a room on the 3rd floor facing away from the main street so it was very quiet. I always prepare for rooms to be smaller in UK than what I get in Australia for the same rate, but I was still taken aback at the tiny size of the room. You can just get around the double bed. The bathroom was relatively roomy though, and the empty corner of the bathroom came in handy for storing my suitcase. While the room was fresh painted, the overall decor was tired, however the room & ensuite were both spotlessly clean. The room's window opens, which is a blessing as the room had no aircon. I was glad it wasn't Summer; the room was very warm & stuffy. I made immediate use of the provided plug-in table fan (& each night I slept with both the fan on & the window open). The bed was extremely comfortable and the standard continental breakfast of cereal, toast & fruit is nothing exciting but it's included and does the trick. The Express Victoria is positioned as a base for business travelers & whilst it's clean, central & quiet, but I cant help thinking it's falling behind in this category. Most travelers would surely expect a work area (the room's portable 20cm TV was taking up the tiny desk), aircon in their room & free Wifi. The room served its purpose, and if you need a room in Pimlico/Victoria 1 night or 2 to rest your head, consider it (just not in Summer). For more than 2 nights, there are better quality hotel rooms in this price category that are just a few tube stops away.

Reviews.Title: “Compact, convenient with fabulous shower but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LHOCtraveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfy bed and pillows, modern bathroom with fabulous hand-held shower. The rooms are very small, as noted by other travelers, but they do have some handy storage cubbies and counter space in the bathroom. Our shower soap dispenser was empty the first night of our stay and the sink faucets were very difficult to turn on and off. After reporting both problems, the soap was refilled but faucets remained a problem. Mediocre continental style breakfast included. The prices fluctuate according to demand and can be overpriced at $135.00. WARNING: Don't ask them to get you a taxi for anywhere in London city. They called us a private taxi that would have cost us 20 pounds to go ten minutes away to a theater in the west end. We got out and hailed an official cab and ended up paying 12 pounds. The private taxi is a good deal only if going a long distance. For example, they will take you to Heathrow for only 45 pounds. We moved to a less expensive, larger room down the street at the Luna Simone that was 90 pounds a night. The breakfasts were better and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HaysteLondon
Reviews.Content: On first impression this hotel is very compact; the room, although very clean and nicely decorated was tiny, there wasn't even enough room for an ironing board to be stored in the room and we had to go down to reception to get one. Once this was set up we couldn't move!!! There isn't any air conditioning so it was really hot, on checking with friends staying on the same floor they too complaned of the room temperature so it wasn't a one off. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly unlike the cleaning staff who came into a room at 9:00am while we were still in bed! As if this wasn't bad enought they knocked on our door again at 9:30am and again at 10:00am (check out wasn't until 11am!) The location is fantastic, just 2 minutes to Pimlico tube on the Victoria line. Breakfast was OK, ceral and coffee without a choice of a cooked breakfast. Overall a nice little hotel if you will only be in the room for a few hours and are not planning on staying more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Express hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jedburglives
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as my first choice was booked out. I chose this hotel after reading the reviews and getting an online booking confirmation that stated spacious work area, flat screen TV, coupled with the write up on the re-freshed boutique style, I thought I was onto a good thing. The staff are very pleasent and helpful. The hotel is small and clean. The Holiday Inn branding is noticable. However, on arrival, reality hit me, the room I was informed of was nothing but a std small room. I tried seriously to find another hotel but too short notice. Don't even think about mentioning your Priority Club card. Mines Platinum and they did not know what it was!

Reviews.Title: “litlle and sweet”
Reviews.Author: ninus11
Reviews.Content: very tidy and clean rooms and overall feeling.Rooms were very small but cosy. Breakfast was ok coffee,cerials toast etc. No egg's or bacon or nothing extra.Location was exellent short walk to underground and neigborhood was safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: PaulaSkinner
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very close to Pimlico Tube and a hop from Victoria by cab. Room was quite small but clean and adequate for the one night I stayed. Bathroom very clean, just a shower no bath and lift to 4th floor no problem. Breakfast was continental style but good selection. Would definitely use again if in area.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in London's city centre”
Reviews.Author: neorkeo
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel through TripAdvisor and I'm so happy about the site and the previous reviews. I really enjoyed the stay. Top of the list: the service and the concierge desk, the location, the value-for-money. The service was excellent. Not intrusive, the people were very friendly and went out of their way to help with anything we asked them. They gave us great tips about nearby supermarkets, hotels and an excellent mailing service. The location was very good, even if it's actually closer to Pimlico station than Victoria. Nevertheless, it was an easy fifteen-minute walk to Victoria station. The room was small but very well equipped and had a fantastic view. We had asked for a quiet room and that's what we got. It was a bit warmer than I would have liked and that's probably the only shortcoming I can think of. In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone interested in a hotel that has a lot of amenities and very professional service, a place you can rely on, if you are not too big on character and atmosphere. Also, I wish it had free wi-fi access, which is the other thing I missed. For its price, it's an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinsi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days in London, 4 nights at the HIE London Victoria htl. The location is great, very close to Pimlico Tube station and Victoria Station (train and Tube). Bus connections also available within short walk reach. The staff was polite and we had no problem in getting what we needed. We were given a quite spacious queen size bedded room on the second floor, equipped with a private bath in good conditions, tv set with pay tv (no lcd screen), tea-coffe maker, etc. We didn't use internet, but you can get connected by paying a daily fee. Breakfast was served in a rather small room on the lower ground level, but were satisfied with the food quality. In short, it is a good hotel in a central location at affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Express Victoria ... Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Tonyuk53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay, we asked for a quiet room and one at the rear of the hotel was provided although the traffic on Belgrave road is not at all noisy. Rooms are clean and soft beds provided a good nights sleep at least for me, but my wife disagrees on this one, also simple breakfast choice but eat as much as you want is included in price. Walking back to the hotel at night from the underground station we did not feel at all intimidated or threatened, the location is ideal. Also this hotel is in an excellent location for visiting all the main tourist attractions. Tate Britain, Houses of Parliament and the London Eye are just a 20-25 minute walk from hotel. We each purchased a Â£18.40 3 day travel card for unlimited use on the underground and buses within zones 1-2, considering a single journey cost each of us Â£4.00 from Kings Cross to Victoria then they are a bargain. Go to www.tfl.gov.uk for info. Tip! Use the Pimlico underground station just 5mins walk. If you want to visit Tate modern then show your travel card to get reduced ticket prices. There are many excellent restaurants just a few minutes walk away ranging from English Pub Grub, Fish and Chips, Turkish, Indian, Chinese youâ€™re spoilt for choice. Go to www.toptable.com for some excellent restaurants. Warning donâ€™t take your car, parking feeâ€™s and congestion charging will leave you out of pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: gpdLondon
Reviews.Content: One night, to catch an early train to Gatwick next morning. We left before breakfast so can't comment on that. The walls are so thin you can hear your neighbour's neighbour....The room was overheated, I didnt like it at all. I guess it is not a lot of money for the location but I would definitely try somewhere else next time. I felt sorry for the night porter; it didnt look as though he had any colleagues to allow him to take a break, and was still on duty when we checked out 8 hours after arriving. It is about 8 minutes to walk to Victoria Station

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for short stays”
Reviews.Author: cogran
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in February 2009 on a business trip. For a hotel in London, it was good value. A colleague had a room on the fifth floor with great views of the London Eye. My room was on the second floor at the back of the hotel and pretty quiet - the only noise I noticed was from a local clock tower chiming (on the hour!). The room layout was fine for one - but a little tight for two if you want to spend more than a couple of days and have a lot of luggage. I guess it had been remodelled recently because it had a modern design, a very comfortable bed, a choice of pillows, a relatively spacious bathroom, and a generous shower with one of those very rare curtains that actually works and stops the bathroom floor flooding. The reception staff were friendly and effective. The only thing missing was free Wi-Fi access - but if you're desperate you can buy airtime by the hour or day. Overall Iâ€™d recommend this hotel for business travellers and those looking for a safe, convenient location for a short London break.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the Step”
Reviews.Author: Groovee
Reviews.Content: When looking for a hotel for a long weekend in London, we automatically checked the Express by Holiday Inn website. When it came down to it, we needed a family room to accomodate 4 of us and we didn't want to pay the extortionate prices a lot of hotels wanted from us. We had the choice between Hammersmith which was a bit further out than we wanted and Victoria. Looking at things Pimlico was our nearest tube station so changing at victoria for the 2 minute ride after we came from Paddington was quite easy. The first problem was which exit to go out of. Rayneman is the best exit and you cross the road by the library before heading straight past the shops and on to St George's Square and turning right. On the opposite side of the street a few seconds walk you will find the hotel at 106. It's clearly marked. The area is quiet and we felt extremely safe here. We did realise that we were in the flight path early one morning when someone left our window open overnight. But otherwise you heard the odd banging off doors but not much else. On entering the hotel as I did every time I walked in the front door, I tripped over the step. Check in was done efficently and quickly with everything explained easily. Our room was on the ground floor overlooking some flats. We could see a roof outside our room and further along the conservatory roof of the breakfast room. Our room was very spacious for an Express. We had a fold out sofa bed at one end and a proper double bed at the other. The toilet was just next to the double bed. The TV was facing the sofa bed which seemed a bit odd as we'd normally put the children in the sofa bed and watch tv. Tea and coffee facilities were provided but we never used them. The bathroom wasn't your usual express layout. This one didn't have the door which made the toilet area more private. The shower was ok and the space was bigger than we have had in the past at other hotels. Overall it was all very clean and tidy. Breakfast is held 7.30-10.30am on weekends and 7-10am on week days. Breakfast room is very small and in the basement. The steps down were a bit narrow and there was a minor step to the top of these stairs which you had to watch incase you fell down. The tables are a bit squashed. There was a range of 4 cereals, 2 types of bread, croissants and a couple of pastries. Some yoghurts and grapefruits were available with some fresh fruit such as apples, pears or oranges. They also had some small rolls one morning. We did hear someone ask if they had something else and being told that if it wasn't on the shelf then there was none left. There was a bar next to reception with a small lounge area. Staff were attentive and helpful everytime we went. There was a vending machine but we advise using one of the shops down the street for water and snacks. The internet access was Â£1 for 10 minutes and painfully slow. We gave up attempting to check in for our flight as it was taking too long. Staff were helpful at telling you how to get places and the best routes to take. Overall as a base to be in London we found this location to be ideal and that the tube service was very good and quicker than we have had in previous stays around London. The victoria line gives easy access to anywhere and I would recommend this as a base to anyone who is looking for a quiet safe area to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: worthingwanderer
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel within walking distance of Victoria Station, and thought it safer to opt for a recognised chain, as some London privately owned hotels can be a bit substandard. The HI Express was about 10-15 minutes from the station (5 minutes from Pimlico Underground), along a pleasant road, which consisted mainly of a selection of hotels. Check-in was friendly, and there was no problem about the fact it was only just after midday. We had a room on the 5th (top) floor, at the back, with views across South London and Battersea Power Station. The room was very quiet, - in fact we began to wonder if the hotel was empty. Our room was small but comfortable, and I was particularly pleased we could open the windows fully for fresh air. Throughout our stay the staff were always very friendly and helpful The only grumbles were the a) lack of power in the shower. At times it was more like a dribble - possibly a result of being on the top floor. and b) the size of the breakfast room in the basement. We were fairly early, and managed to find a table, but there were guests milling around waiting for people to finish and leave so they could sit down. It was also a bit hot there when it was full of people. Location wise the hotel was perfect. The 24 bus went past the door, giving direct links to Westminster, Victoria, and Trafalgar Square. We were able to walk to Pimlico tube, and also to Tate Britain and the river. There were numerous restaurants within walking distance, ranging form small independent ones to chains such as Zizzi, Prezzo, and Garfunkles. The area felt very safe, even after dark. It may not have been the cheapest deal in the area, but it was exactly what we had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: adrianhobson
Reviews.Content: For an mid-week business stay at Â£90 the hotel lived up to expectations. Belgravia Road is a pleasant terrace of, mainly, hotels and the area is pleasant and feels safe. Pimlico Tube Station is 5 mins walk and Victoria is about 10 mins. Facilities are, as you'd expect for HIX, fairly basic but theres a good choice of restaurants and pubs in a 5 min radius and lots more if you walk as far as Victoria station. No Aircon. The windows open but then traffic noise can then be a problem. I had a single on the 5th floor which felt a bit like the servants quarters and had a TV which was small enough to be a Sat Nav! Slow lift. Overall however it was OK. Breakfast in a basement breakfast room was adequate although I've seen better at HIX. At the right rate this would make an excellent tourist hotel - quiet area and close to main train/busstation and Tube.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: MegLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express Victoria is average. Traveling on a budget, our options for accomodations in London were limited but felt confident that this hotel would meet our needs. We arrived at the hotel around 1am and were greeted by a friendly man. The room was clean but worn. The bed didn't invite a cozy nights sleep, the sheets were stained and the bed was a little saggy. The bathroom was clean and practical. Our room was facing Belgrave Road, but we were not bothered by noise on the street at all. The location is not ideal, but works if people are willing to use public transportation to get in to the city or walk longer distances to see sights. We opted to walk everywhere and were about 3 miles from Big Ben and Westminster Abbey. All in all, the hotel was decent but wouldn't go back to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Nikonaut
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good value for money and nice, clean room. I will probably stay here again the next time I am in London. I didn't try the hotel breakfast, as the area is full of excellent cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: varneykr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk to Victoria Station and very convenient to all London touristy sights. Its in a quieter neighborhood and we found Belgravia to be just charming. However, we had a first floor room and the second night when the upstairs guests checked in it sounded like a herd of elephants were above us. Every time they walked it was so loud I was up all night. I was not impressed with that. Overall the service was wonderful, breakfast was sufficient and the staff was helpful with directions and information. I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: singinggigi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7 years ago and I thought the location was excellent. I needed to find a hotel relatively close to Victoria Station this time I flied into London. I had to fly from Venice's Marco Polo into London's Gatwick and needed to catch the Gatwick Express to go to Victoria Station. From Victoria Station, it took me 10 minutes to walk to the hotel with luggage. I felt that was convenient enough so that I did not need to deal with the cab drivers. I agree with other traveler's that the rooms are kind of small. I had a twin room. The bathroom was comparatively big. It was a clean and quiet residental section of London. I arrived at 6 pm and the fact that there was no air-conditioning got me a bit. Other than that, I had no problem with my stay. Continental breakfast was served with crossiants, yogarts, toast and cheese. The front desk staff was super friendly. I needed to check in online for my flight the next day and I did not have a printer. The staff helped me checkin my flight and print all my boarding passes. Then she arranged an airport transfer for me. All these came unexpected in a good way. I have been very pleased with my stay and I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay, but would not return unless I had to”
Reviews.Author: Steve5839
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and use Holiday Inns regularly, so know the formular, but a few pointers on this one. Location ok, tube access ok, now for the gripes, no cooling so the windows have to be left open and if your room is on the back the people in the garden can be noisy and go to bed late. My room had a soil stack in it, which let some odd odours into the room, the bar has only larger. Not one of the best, but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for my business trip”
Reviews.Author: bigburd
Reviews.Content: As a single woman travelling alone on a business trip, I found this hotel adequate for my needs. The room was big enough, double bed, a sofa bed and a small open wardrobe. My room didn't have any view at all and there was quite a lot of noise from the rooms above but this wasn't important to me as I was out most of the day anyway. The hotel was clean and nicely decorated, although it is starting to look a little shabby. It has a good location and is within walking distance of some of the main attractions in London. Near train, bus, tube stops. Lots of eating places nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but mostly sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Akkrenskarin
Reviews.Content: I shared a twin room with a friend for one night, whilst attending a concert in London. The hotel is situated on a quiet residential road, and in a front-facing room I noticed no disturbance from passing traffic. Staff were helpful enough, and available when required, but did not appear to make any particular effort to be welcoming or friendly. The room itself was very small, but adequate for a single night's stay. It was clean, and the beds were comfortable. My main complaint would be with the shower - no power at all, and not much heat either. I don't think it too much to ask that one should be able to wash one's hair in comfort, but this was not possible here. However, the bathroom was clean, and soap, shower gel etc were provided. Breakfast, although hard to locate, was perfectly sufficient, with a wide choice, and there were staff on hand at all times. All in all, there was nothing much wrong with this hotel as a place for an over-night stop, but I wouldn't want to stay there any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: jerseyfirst-timer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip - the reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful and kindly arranged numerous cabs for our party of nine. The bedroom was small but fine - some people may have been disappointed by the size but it wasn't a problem for one night. Overall my stay would have been absolutely fine apart from the noise - the windows are single glazed so every car going past is heard, which is amplified once you have the television off and are trying to sleep (this carried on throughout the night). Also as well as hearing the person above me walking around I could also clearly hear the bed creaks, footsteps and television of the room next door! If you are a heavy sleeper this won't affect you and you should have a relatively pain-free stay. If you're a light sleeper then consider taking ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: joh1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in room 303 which is at the front of the building overlooking the main road. It's a 5 minute walk from Pimlico Underground. A number of small shops and cafe/pubs nearby for snacks, takeaways,alcohol and soft drinks, Area was fine and I felt safe walking there alone although I didn't venture out in the evening. Check in was efficient and we were allowed to check in at 11am. Reception had info leaflets, internet access and fax facility and a very small bar area. Room was small (about 10ft x 12ft in the main sleeping area) but clean. Extra pillows were provided. There was a small TV and a desk with desk light, small travel kettle with tea and coffee including decaff coffee. Bathroom was also quite compact but adequate. The shower cubicle was quite spacious given the size of the room. Lux and Dove shower and handwash products were provided. The shower didn't exactly deliver a powerful drenching flow but it was hot. Some noise was apparent from the road in the afternoon and early morning (5.30am) but it was quiet during the night. The room upstairs had a very creaky floor and I could track the occupants movements. Fortunately they didn't walk around much! Breakfast is served in the basement and is a continental self service set up. (Croissants, jam, cheese, yoghurt, toast with 2 self service toasters, cereal, tea, coffee, juice) There was seating for approx 38 people and although it was fine when we visited I think it might possibly get busy at some times. It is a reasonable enough motel style no frills hotel, adequate for just a night. Delivers what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jayaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on New Year's Eve. We wanted to be within walking distance of the London Eye to see the firework display. The hotel is within 5mins walk of Pimlico tube station. We were very lucky as our 5th floor room had a view of the Eye and Big Ben. The room was clean, and an adequate size. The staff were friendly. The only real moan is breakfast- the room is way too small to cope and we were asked to come back in 10 mins. We said no, because there was no guarantee there would be a free table then. As we left, a queue was forming. We grabbed a couple of croissants and pots of yoghurt and took them back to our room. The croissants were terrible though, really stale and chewy. That said, this hotel is in a good location within 15-20mins walk of Westminster, and less than 10mins from the Tate, so I would recommend it- just don't get too excited about breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Only_the_truth
Reviews.Content: The Good bits: Clean, Quiet, Good location, (Pimlico Tube - 3 mins, Victoria Tube/Bus station - 10 mins). Not So Good: Room Small, they supply a luggage rack, but there's nowhere to place it. There is no air con, but not a problem in December. The Heating is OK. Breakfast room too small & overcrowded, but the buffet is OK. Overall - no unpleasant surprises. If you have stayed in a Holiday Inn Express then you will know what to expect. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a bed”
Reviews.Author: UKfanfromVA
Reviews.Content: It was clean but not air conditioned and very warm. Mattress was thin and lumpy. Nice shower but rest of accomodation not up to USA standards.

Reviews.Title: “So small and hot”
Reviews.Author: jabbawarrior
Reviews.Content: Managed to find a meter outside so I could unload car. Hotel very hot, worlds slowest lift to take me 4 floors to worlds smallest room. Small single bed with about a foot surrounding it to each wall. Hotel generally clean and breakfast was basic but okay (and free). Given the rate I paid I wouldn't say this was value for money. Booked this hotel as Holiday Inn normally a good chain, but this one well below par.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - great area”
Reviews.Author: andrewnicholas
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Victoria in London is a very good quality hotel, centrally located just two stops on the tube from Green Park and a ideal base for tourists or business people on a limited budget. Reservation staff are friendly and informative, roooms are clean and comfortable, a small but adequate bar area and a spacious breakfast room with a varied continental breakfast included in your room rate. There is a real community feel to the area and there are a number of old fashioned English pubs within walking distance serving meals and drinks at reasonable prices.The real advantage is the location is the nearby tube - approximately 3 minutes, connects with all of the major tourist and business areas of London. As a frequent visitor I would recommend this area over the well advertised but inferior hotels in the Paddington / Earlscourt area where most of the bargain hotels are dumps only fit for demolition.This is a good value product from Holiday Inn, excellent standard , reasonable rates and suitable for all kinds of visitor to London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfic For The Job”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price. I stayed in a single room which was big enough, I have stayed in smaller rooms in London for a higher prices, it was clean and tidy and everything worked fine. The staff were friendly and keen to help. I think the bad reviews stem from people who expected this hotel to be part of the holiday experience, in this respect it cant compete. It is however EXCELLENT for anyone going to London for short stays and just needs a place to sleep. Basically it is a typical 3 star hotel, clean, tidy and does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Matchbox”
Reviews.Author: scotlad09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel whilst on business in London. Previous experience of HIEX was that they indeed were cheap but also comfortable. This was not the case at this hotel. The staff on arrival were dismissive to confirming my payment for the booking from my corporate travel agent. When I offered to pay by cheque I was told that HIEX didnt accept cheques, I later found out they did. The room was so small it was embarrasing to move around without bumping into my partner with every trip to the toilet. Bedside tables collapsed when items were placed on them (coffee cup in one case). The only postive to the hotel was the shower and free shower gel. Breakfast was served in what felt like (and looked like) a converted bedroom in the dungeon of the hotel. Would never reccomend this hotel, it really lets the HIEX brand down.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, bit small, but nice just the same”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room on the smallish side, but I'm told that's to be expected in this area. This family of 4 was able to fit quite a bit of luggage (2 large and 2 medium rolling suitcases, another large suitcase, a briefcase, and 3 book backpacks) into room 504, which is situated on the top floor at the front of the building. From our window, we could see across the rooftops across the street to the London Eye and Big Ben clock tower. The room was clean, the shower was hot, check in was easy and the staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast, included, was something that we took full advantage of. Choices included: fresh apples, oranges, bananas, canned fruit cocktail, yogurt, several varieties of individually boxed cereals, croissants, white and wheat bread for toasting, cheddar cheese, and a variety of butter, jams, and spreads for toast. There were also three flavors of juice, coffee, espresso, hot chocolate, and several flavors of tea to drink. We filled up on breakfast and so were able to skip lunch and save a bit. Glad we weren't staying in the warmer weather, though. I'm told that many budget-priced hotels in London area don't have A/C, and it was already fairly warm in our room. We slept with the window open and the fan running each night. I thought it odd that there was no screen in the window, but again that seems to be the norm, rather than the exception. Overall, quite a pleasant three-night stay. (We forgot to take photos of the room, but I've shared some pics of our view and the breakfast buffet.)
